summary:
**Meeting Overview**:  
The Judicial Nominating Commission of the City of Dallas will hold a meeting on October 30, 2024, at 6:00 PM, both via videoconference and in-person at City Hall. The primary purpose of the meeting is to discuss judicial appointments and evaluation metrics for candidates for the Dallas Municipal Court.

**Key Agenda Items**:  
1. Approval of the minutes from the May 20, 2024 meeting.
2. Discussion on the vacant full-time judge position for the Dallas Municipal Court.
3. Consideration of appointing a replacement or additional associate judge.
4. Development of metrics for evaluating judicial applicants, including potential collaboration with the Dallas Bar Association and feedback from relevant legal associations.

**Important Details**:  
The commission will address the need to fill a vacant full-time judge position and may discuss the appointment of an associate judge. Additionally, there will be a proposal to enhance the evaluation process for judicial candidates, potentially expanding the bar poll to include municipal judges.

**Action Items**:  
The commission seeks approval for the minutes from the previous meeting and will deliberate on the judicial appointments. The meeting may also include a closed executive session to discuss legal advice and personnel matters related to the appointments. The decisions made will impact the selection of judges for the Dallas Municipal Court.
